Description: Fragment of an ostracon from a closed pottery vessel that was incised with a pot-mark after the vessel was fired. The pot-mark shows some hieroglyphs facing to the right: a possible t on top of another sign, maybe Z5, then a bird like sA (G39) on top of another sign that is broken off, maybe an r? The vessel is wheel made, closed shape, Nile clay(?) with a beige self-slip.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E14.1, upper level
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 71)
